content: No, solicitors in the UK are prohibited from charging contingency fees for their services by the Solicitors Regulation Authority. This means that they cannot charge clients a percentage of the compensation or award that they receive in a case. Instead, solicitors generally charge based on hourly rates, fixed fees, or a combination of both. There are some exceptions to this rule, such as for certain types of personal injury cases, but in general, contingency fees are not allowed.
